results.title: Special Project no. 14: Marlo-Mallacoota-Cape Conran
results.brief_description: The Country Roads Board’s Project no. 14 involves the building of a road from Orbost to Marlo. Shows the first section to Cape Conran and difficulties encountered in clearing and leveling the sandy loam. The area opened by the road has great development potential in its attractive surf beaches, bushland and off-shore oil drilling. Photography by Jim Stirling.

results.title: Ram sales
results.brief_description: This is a general interest film which shows typical scenes at the annual Sydney sheep show, including judging. It also illustrates the different areas of country in relation to ram types, and shows various wool fabrics and types of wool from which fabrics are manufactured. Photography by Tom Price and commentary by Wilfred Thomas.

results.title: Lease of life
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: Presents the Victorian Cancer Institute’s 4MeV linear accelerator. An important weapon against cancer, it is used for deep X-ray therapy. Traces a case history of a woman who is eventually restored to her family by the special treatment made possible by the accelerator. Narrated by Marcia Hart. Filmed at the Peter MacCallum Cancer Institute in Melbourne, Victoria.

results.title: The Dandenong Story
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson and Cine Service Productions
results.brief_description: Dandenong, Victoria, named after an Aboriginal tribe, is a fast growing town. As the gateway to Gippsland and the Latrobe Valley, it is important for agriculture. But even more significant is the development of big industrial plants manufacturing goods such as carpets, trucks, cars and fruit cans. Such decentralization of industry is bringing prosperity and a high standard of living to Dandenong and Australia as a whole.

results.title: [Cinesound Review 1950-1965]
results.brief_description:
This film contains excerpts from Cinesound Review, a news broadcast that covered significant social, cultural and political events in Australia. The film features a number of different clips from newsreels between 1950 and 1965.

The first section, titled ‘1950 Melbourne Cup’, shows the horse race at Flemington Racecourse, photographed by Ron Horner. The film includes close-ups of people in the crowd, and commentary of the race as Comic Court wins. This is followed by a section titled ‘Scone Rodeo: Bronchos (sic) on the Bust’, featuring footage of a horse rodeo in Scone, New South Wales.

The third section, titled ‘Fur Flies: Battling Budgerigar K.O.’s Cat’ features a playfight between two pets, a ginger cat and a budgerigar. In the fourth section we see ANZAC Day parades in Melbourne and Sydney, preluded by the title ‘ANZAC: Nation’s Homage’.

The fifth section is titled ‘Skiing: Day and Night Fun at Mt. Buller’, with commentary by David Low. It features children learning how to ski and social activities in the resorts, including bands and dancing. This is followed by an excerpt called ‘Clark Well Ahead’, showing the motorcar race at the 1965 British Grand Prix, won by Jim Clark.

The film ends with a cartoon called ‘Local Boy Makes Good: A Story with a Moral’ and three feature film trailers: ‘The Counterfeit Traitor’ (1962), ‘Pollyanna’ (1960) and ‘Mein Kampf’ (1960).

The first section, titled ‘1950 Melbourne Cup’, shows the horse race at Flemington Racecourse, photographed by Ron Horner. The film includes close-ups of people in the crowd, and commentary of the race as Comic Court wins. results.title: Family antics
results.creator_credit: J. Campbell Dobbie and Peerless Films
results.brief_description: Dad sits down to enjoy a beer in the back garden and listen to the news but sees his son has other ideas, and forces him to do acrobatic tricks.

results.title: This was Chadstone
results.brief_description: An example of student film production. Presents student activities motivated by popular music, contrasted with the more regimented school assembly. Features Chadstone High School, Melbourne.
